topics.body:
So, guys, I gotta know something. Let's say you've known your girlfriend/boyfriend for a while, right? They're seriously a great, caring person, and you have no doubt in your mind about that. But then, all of a sudden, they tell you some really shitty view for an even shittier reason - like, say, refusing to acknowledge the existence of their child if he/she came out as trans because "God wouldn't like it" - what then? You know that they're so much more than that one terrible view, but it's just so bad. Add that to the fact that when you told them it was shitty, they told you to go fuck yourself.

Yeah, this is _totally_ hypothetical.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5352a2e463687248284c0100#post_5352a2e463687248284c0100
That happens, you won't see eye-to-eye on everything. Don't let one or two different views on things ruin a relationship. Part of a good relationship is learning to live with those differences and accept someone even if they are not completely in agreement with you.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5352a8d3636872165c250000#post_5352a8d3636872165c250000

Oh, believe me, I wasn't going to break up over it, but my friends have me giving me hell about it ever since they found out.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535243156368726601120100#post_535243156368726601120100
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53522ab86368727ff71e0000#post_53522ab86368727ff71e0000
I don't think the Singularity is ever going to happen. Ray Kurzweil may be a computer genius, but he doesn't know jack shit about biology or neuroscience and he also believes in quack medicine.[/bq]
I'm going to have to disagree with you here on the premise of the blue brain project is making a lot of major strides as of late.

The purpose of the blue brain project is to map how the human brain works and reverse engineer it.  When you get right down to it the human brain is just another computer, albeit a very complex one.  The problem we as a species seem to have is that we're extremely arrogant about our own abilities.  Even though we have machines that can outperform us in a lot of fields we still believe that we are fundamentally superior to everything in every facet imaginable.

The other problem we have is that we're arrogant about our understanding of technological advancement.  Fifty years ago if you told someone that we would have machines that can perform better than humans and that technological advancement would be causing mass unemployment due to people getting replaced in the workforce you probably would have gotten locked up in a insane asylum and people calling you a "crazy dirty commie" or something along the lines.

In a hundred years we're going to have laptops so powerful that their computational ability is more than the combined computational ability of the entire human race combined.  What I mean by this is say in a hundred years if a single laptop is more powerful than the entire human race's mental capacity don't you think running a simulation of a single human's brain is possible?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
>_> Well fuck me sideways.

Turns out the usa is a oligarchy, not a democracy.  You know how money plays a big factor in usa politics?  Well someone looked into the effects of that on our government and presto turns out the biggest factor into whether or not something becomes a law is whether or not it has financial support from the wealthy.

Ding dong democracy is dead.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5352cee763687219499a0100#post_5352cee763687219499a0100
Not that I support any bans on substances, but Prohibition worked to a degree mainly in smaller rural communities. It was in urban environments where such measures failed miserably.

Switzerland and Scandinavia have small population, so lot of things could work out there.

Sucks that people never seem to learn.
